quotes.quote: Getting sober is a radically creative act.
I have taken more out of alcohol than alcohol has taken out of me.
If you wish to keep the mind clear and the body healthy, abstain from all fermented liquors.
If it is a small sacrifice to discontinue the use of wine, do it for the sake of others; if it is a great sacrifice, do it for your own.
Ya think that the whiskey tastes good? Try a big cup of sobriety - now that is the good stuff!
Sobriety is the strength of the soul, for it preserves its reason unclouded by passion.
There is nothing wrong with sobriety in moderation.
Getting sober just exploded my life. Now I have a much clearer sense of myself and what I can and can't do. I am more successful than I have ever been.
Sobriety is love of health, or inability to eat much.
I've always believed clear-eyed sobriety was for the harder hearted.
Seriousness is the only refuge of the shallow.
It's a great advantage not to drink among hard drinking people.
Sober up, and you see and hear everything you'd been able to avoid hearing before.
Temperance is moderation in the things that are good and total abstinence from the things that are foul.
Temperance is simply a disposition of the mind which binds the passion.
Temperance is a mean with regard to pleasures.
Temperance gives Nature her full play, and enables her to exert herself in all her force and vigour.
Temperance to be a virtue must be free, and not forced.
Temperance is a bridle of gold; he who uses it rightly, is more like a god than a man.

Temperance keeps the senses clear and unembarrassed, and makes them seize the object with more keenness and satisfaction. It appears with life in the face, and decorum in the person; it gives you the command of your head, and secures your health, and preserves you in a condition for business.
Temperance in everything is requisite for happiness.
Complete abstinence is easier than perfect moderation.
Abstinence is the great strengthener and clearer of reason.
Temperance is the wisdom to know that not every constructive job requires a hammer.
The smaller the drink, the clearer the head, and the cooler the blood.
In temperance there is ever cleanliness and elegance.
Seriousness is stupidity sent to college.
Being sober on a bus is, like, totally different than being drunk on a bus.
Abstinence is a window of clarity through which one can better find one's work and one's mate.
The thing is, if I don't have sobriety, I don't have anything.
